author: @mandalorian1992
text: So the problem here is LLMs or LLM based models cannot attain AGL. DEVIN is just a work flow automation tool that is based over GPT 4. It says in their specifications that it can do about 13% of the work.  The main issue with these tools when competing with a human is as a follows:  1.) Ability to understand context of a larger problem along with assessing the technical/ business eco system surrounding a problem.  2.) These tools are stuck in a time snapshot while humans learn live on the go and learn from past experiences, future changes that can come and can customize the solution.  3.) The ability to blend - Humans can break down a problem into smaller pieces and find the best solution of those pieces and make a product by blending stuffs from these different sources to build something which is truly unique and tailored to their context. This is the toughest ability that is being explored right now.  Where tools like these shine is the ability to learn fast. We Human are slow to absorb and process information. This is a major disadvantage here.  So just like gpt this tool would do basic, repetitive stuff done very quickly and efficiently. So in near term, this is going to replace lazy programmers and also mediocre freshers for sure.  I would urge all to keep yourself updated, learn as much as you can. Happy learning. Cheers!
